channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Harvey Weinstein’s Conviction Was Fragile From the Start
item.description: New York’s highest court overturned a conviction on Thursday that tested how #MeToo cases could be tried.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: U.S. and 17 Other Nations Call on Hamas to Release Hostages
item.description: “The fate of the hostages and the civilian population in Gaza, who are protected under international law, is of international concern,” the leaders said in a joint statement.

item.title: Domino's will tip you if you tip your driver
How Karen McDougal’s Story of an Affair With Trump Became a Commodity
item.description: Karen McDougal sold the rights to her story. Donald J. Trump and the publisher of The National Enquirer decided what would happen to it.

item.title: Iran Sentences Prominent Rapper to Death, Lawyer Says
item.description: The rapper, Toomaj Salehi, was initially arrested after releasing music in support of the 2022 protests over the death of a young woman in police custody.

item.title: High interest rates catch up to economic growth as GDP slows dramatically to 1.6%
item.description: Consumers kept spending at a solid pace, but overall, the economy's “momentum is cooling," said one economist.

item.title: U.S. Economy Grew at 1.6% Rate in First-Quarter Slowdown
item.description: Consumers ensured that growth continued, but the latest data showed signs of vulnerability elsewhere.

item.title: A Chinese Firm Is America’s Favorite Drone Maker — Except in Washington
item.description: U.S. authorities consider DJI a security threat. Congress is weighing legislation to ban it, prompting a lobbying campaign from the company, which dominates the commercial and consumer drone markets.

item.title: Sam Altman’s Worldcoin eyeing partnerships with PayPal and OpenAI
item.description: Tools for Humanity has dropped hints it soon could be collaborating with major tech and finance companies, despite a declining rate of new users.

item.title: A Chinese Firm Is America’s Favorite Drone Maker — Except in Washington
item.description: U.S. authorities consider DJI a security threat. Congress is weighing legislation to ban it, prompting a lobbying campaign from the company, which dominates the commercial and consumer drone markets.

item.title: ‘We’re Aware of the Location’: Aid Groups in Gaza Coordinated With I.D.F. but Still Came Under Fire
item.description: Visual evidence and internal communications obtained by The Times shows six aid groups based in Western countries, including Israel’s strongest allies, had humanitarian sites hit by Israeli strikes, even after the locations were shared with the I.D.F.

item.title: PBS Retro brings back your childhood favorite shows
item.description: Options include Mister Rogers Neighborhood, Zoboomafoo and Reading Rainbow.

item.title: You’ve Been Wronged. That Doesn’t Make You Right.
item.description: Never has our culture made the claiming of complaint such an animating force.

item.title: Macron, Battling Far Right at Home, Pushes for Stronger E.U.
item.description: In a major speech, France’s president returned to a familiar theme, warning that “Our Europe is mortal” if it does not become more self-sufficient.

item.title: Movement Labs raises $38 million to build layer 2 blockchain on Ethereum with Facebook tech
item.description: Polychain led the Series A funding round, which included participation from Hack VC, dao5, and Robot Ventures.
